page.title: 11Landscape & Build.-Ide Hill
page.content: {Great Norman Street Farm} A 15th.C hall house of timber framing with alterations. Inside there is a great deal of exposed timber beams with very heavy diagonal bracing and the remains of a screen passage. {Little Norman Street Farmhouse} Probable 16th.C timber-framed building three bays in length and two storeys in height with an attic above. Now tile hung on the upper floor and with painted brick infilling to the ground floor. {Brook Place Farmhouse} The existing main building is of about 1740 incorporating a 16th. century timber-framed structure. There is a beam inside the house carved with the date 1721 which probably dates the eastern side of the house.
